meanings.definition: The act of sinking or the process of sinking.
meanings.sent1: The sinkages of the ship were visible as it slowly went underwater.
meanings.sent2: The sinkages of the rocks in the pond created a deep hole.
meanings.sent3: The sinkages of the cake in the oven made it look like a delicious crater.
meanings.sent4: The sinkages of the city's economy were felt by all its residents.
meanings.sent5: The sinkages of the sandcastle were a result of the incoming tide.

meanings.definition: A place where something sinks or has sunk.
meanings.sent1: The swamp was a sinkages for all the fallen leaves.
meanings.sent2: The old well served as a sinkages for many lost treasures.
meanings.sent3: The sinkages of the quicksand made it a dangerous trap for unwary travelers.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned shipwreck became a sinkages for marine life to thrive.
meanings.sent5: The sinkages of the mud puddle trapped the wheels of the car.

meanings.definition: The amount by which something sinks.
meanings.sent1: The sinkages of the boat was a clear indication of its weight.
meanings.sent2: The sinkages of the ice on the lake varied depending on the temperature.
meanings.sent3: The sinkages of the helium balloon surprised the children at the party.
meanings.sent4: The sinkages of the mattress showed it was time for a replacement.
meanings.sent5: The sinkages of the wooden plank revealed its water damage.
